medical_history.chief_complaint: Ms. L presented with generalized anxiety and multiple somatic complaints, notably sharp and stabbing abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain first occurred after an abortion at age 29, complicated by uterine perforation and sepsis. Symptoms of anxiety, including nervous tension and restlessness, had worsened over time. The abdominal pain was reported as worsening with activity and was persistent.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1) Non-insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus controlled by diet, 2) Bilateral macular degeneration, 3) Peptic ulcer disease, 4) Hypertension. Previous surgeries included hysterectomy, left oophorectomy, vagotomy, dilation and curettage due to complicated pregnancy.
medical_history.family_history: Probable major depressive disorder in a younger sister and in two paternal aunts, one cousin may have been hospitalized for psychotic symptoms.
medical_history.social_history: Raised in a family with limited financial means, divorced after 50 years of marriage, living near one daughter, and engaging in activities like babysitting grandchildren and hobbies, although socially withdrawn.
